battleship.domain

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship.domain.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TargetBoard

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the board on a game of battleship.

    • Method Detail

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard()
        Initiates all board cells to BLANK.

      • drawBoard

        public void drawBoard()
        Draws the board.

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip(int startX,
                int startY,
                int orientation,
                int size)
        Places a ship on the board. Places a ship on the board by first checking that the coordinates are valid and that there are no other ships in the intended squares.
        Parameters:
        startX - starting X-coordinate for ship
        startY - starting Y-coordinate for ship
        orientation - ship orientation
        size - ships size in squares
        Returns:
        return true if ship placed succesfully, otherwise false
        See Also:
        checkPlacementCoords(int, int, int, int)

      • checkPlacementCoords

        public boolean checkPlacementCoords(int startX,
                           int startY,
                           int orientation,
                           int size)
        Check that all intended coordinates for ship placement are on the board.
        Parameters:
        startX - starting X-coordinate for ship placement
        startY - starting Y-coordinate for ship placement
        orientation - ship orientation
        size - ship size in squares
        Returns:
        true if all coordinates valid, otherwise false

      • shoot

        public boolean shoot(int x,
            int y)
        Take a shot at the specified square NOTE: shooting at a square that has already been shot at is considered legal and is not checked.
        Parameters:
        x - X-coordinate for shot
        y - Y-coordinate for shot
        Returns:
        true if shot succesful, otherwise false

        public int shipSquaresLeft()
        Count how many squares on the board have a ship
        Returns:
        number of squares with ships on the board
